instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> and only 5V on PS
threads.message:
Board had some minimal corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C9000</CAPACITOR> and that cap was shorted <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> after removing it short is gone but that line is 0V and board only takes 5V.

I checked for shorts elsewhere and did not find any, <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> gets its power on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_3V3G3H_T</SIGNAL> but enable is missing <SIGNAL>P5V_3V3G3H_EN</SIGNAL> I followed that line and all is good up until PM.

Please advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> and only 5V on PS
threads.message:
SSD voltages must come on before S5 state.
If no low resistance detected on the SSD power rails, then try DFU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> and only 5V on PS
threads.message: No low resistance and no voltage on SSD rails, machine does not enter DFU state even with different entire case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> and only 5V on PS
threads.message: Do you get required voltages around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> and only 5V on PS
threads.message: None, I measured all coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>, sorry for not checking this before posting, bty PPBUS is 12.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> and only 5V on PS
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>?
If yes, check <RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (SYM 1 OF 4 ) LDOs, page 76.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> and only 5V on PS
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7900</RESISTOR> was the problem, thanks so much!
